intro: Rhadinothamnus anceps, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thamnathus, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland heathlands. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. Rhadinothamnus anceps is generally hardy and drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to the harsh conditions of its native environment.
